newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: BBAG SHAREHOLDERS REJECT SAB TAKEOVER PLANS.
newsitem.headline: BBAG SHAREHOLDERS REJECT SAB TAKEOVER PLANS.

text.p: Austrian beverage group BBAG said on Tuesday its majority shareholders had rejected a takeover bid by drinks giant South African Breweries (SAB).
"The controlling shareholders, who met today on short notice because of rumours in several media, have unanimously rejected the takeover designs by South African Breweries," BBAG said in a statement.
The group, which controls two-thirds of the Austrian beer market and has wide-ranging interests in eastern Europe, said SAB's plans had been turned down for "strategic reasons".
BBAG, one of Europe's top 10 brewers, boasts a complicated holding structure that is effectively controlled by five families from the province of Upper Austria, known locally as the "beer dynasty".

The families control a non-operative holding company, called Getraenke Holding (Drinks Holding), which through a series of further holding constructions owns the majority in operative unit Brau Union .
Market rumours about ongoing talks between the two groups had helped boost both BBAG's and Brau Union's stocks in midday trade in an otherwise depressed Vienna market.
